Sentencas: In a systematic study, Samarium doped ceria (SDC) nanopowders, SmxCe1-xO2-x/2 (x = 0.1, 0.2 or 0.3), were prepared by a low temperature citrate complexation route.
Titulo: Preparation and property-performance relationships in samarium-doped ceria nanopowders for solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The synthesis and crystallisation of the SDC powders were followed by thermochemical techniques (TGA/DTA).
Titulo: Preparation and property-performance relationships in samarium-doped ceria nanopowders for solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: X-ray diffraction, elemental analysis, specific surface area determination (BET) and electron microscopy (SEM and TEM).
Titulo: Preparation and property-performance relationships in samarium-doped ceria nanopowders for solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Mean crystallite sizes were found to be around 10 nm for all compositions calcined at 500 degrees C. Dense electrolyte bodies were prepared at 1300 degrees C, 1400 degrees C and 1450 degrees C using two sintering times, 4 h or 6 h. Densities of 91-97% of theoretical were obtained, with a marked improvement in density on going from 1300 degrees C to higher sintering temperatures.
Titulo: Preparation and property-performance relationships in samarium-doped ceria nanopowders for solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Grain size analysis was conducted using SEM.
Titulo: Preparation and property-performance relationships in samarium-doped ceria nanopowders for solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Grain size distributions were related to %Sm and sintering conditions.
Titulo: Preparation and property-performance relationships in samarium-doped ceria nanopowders for solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Impedance spectroscopy was used to determine the total, bulk and grain boundary conductivities, the related activation energies and enthalpies of defect association and ion migration.
Titulo: Preparation and property-performance relationships in samarium-doped ceria nanopowders for solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: Sintering at 1400 degrees C/6 h or 1450 degrees C/4 h gave superior grain structure and conductivity, with oversintering occurring after more severe treatments.
Titulo: Preparation and property-performance relationships in samarium-doped ceria nanopowders for solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: At 600 degrees C the highest total ionic conductivity was 1.81 x 10(-2)
Titulo: Preparation and property-performance relationships in samarium-doped ceria nanopowders for solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes
Preparation and property-performance relationships in samarium-doped ceria nanopowders for solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes

Sentencas: The relationships between chemical composition, sintering parameters, grain structure and electrochemical performance are discussed.
Titulo: Preparation and property-performance relationships in samarium-doped ceria nanopowders for solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes
